author: Special Correspondent
text:
There will be no delay in disbursal of financial assistance to HIV/AIDS affected people, said officials of the Department of Women and Child Development.

In January, the Lieutenant-Governor of Puducherry accorded approval to notify the Financial Assistance to HIV/AIDS Affected People Rules 2015. The rules were devised to render assistance to persons infected by HIV/affected by AIDS taking treatment in the ART (Anti Retroviral Therapy) Centre, who cannot be rehabilitated otherwise.

Assistance may be granted to a person affected by HIV/AIDS of an amount of Rs.1,500 per month up to 59 years of age, Rs.2,000 for those in the age group 60-79 and Rs. 3,000 for 80 years and above.

Some sections of the media had reported that the process of applications from the affected persons has been held up in view of the announcement of poll dates for the Union Territory. An official in the Department of Women and Child Development said, “Over 300 applications were received for assistance. We will soon send the proposal for Finance Department and after obtaining approval from Election Commission, the assistance will be disbursed without any delay.”
title: Aid for people with HIV won’t be delayed: officials
